article.headline: UTEP 61, Clemson 48
article.story: HONOLULU -- Michael Perez scored a career-high 25 points to lead UTEP to a 61-48 victory over Clemson in an opening-round game of the Diamond Head Classic on Thursday. The Miners (5-5) also got 11 points from C.J. Cooper in winning their third straight. K.J. McDaniels scored 13 points and Milton Jennings 10 to lead the Tigers (6-5). UTEP advances to Friday's semifinals, and Clemson will be in the consolation round. UTEP shot 51 percent, made 7 of 20 3-pointers and sank 10 of 12 free throws. Clemson shot just 30 percent and committed 11 turnovers to six assists. The Tigers led 29-24 early in the second half, but UTEP used a 17-11 run capped by Perez's three-point play to seize a 41-40 lead with 12:49 left. The Miners led by 14 points after a finger roll by Cooper inside the final minute. The teams were tied 24-24 at halftime.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
